intro: Pentacalia venturae, commonly known as the Ventura's pentacalia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native range. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
